member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BalloonTip.BalloonControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the internal Balloon control that is used to display Balloon. This property will have valid value only during time Balloon is actually displayed on the screen. Value will also be valid during BalloonDisplaying event. You can use this property to further customize Balloon control before it is displayed to the user. You can also set it to your own instance of the Balloon control (or the control that is inheriting it) for ultimate customization options. Note that new instance of Balloon control is created each time Balloon needs to be displayed. Once Balloon is closed control is disposed.

member.summary: Occurs when popup item is closing. Event is fired only when Bar is used independently of DotNetBarManager.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.PopupContainerLoad
member.summary: Occurs when popup of type container is loading. Event is fired only when Bar is used independently of DotNetBarManager.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.PopupContainerUnload
member.summary: Occurs when popup of type container is unloading. Event is fired only when Bar is used independently of DotNetBarManager.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.PopupOpen
member.summary: Occurs when popup item is about to open. Event is fired only when Bar is used independently of DotNetBarManager.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.PopupShowing
member.summary: Occurs just before popup window is shown. Event is fired only when Bar is used independently of DotNetBarManager.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.BeforeDockTabDisplayed
member.summary: Occurs before dock tab is displayed.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.CaptionButtonClick
member.summary: Occurs when caption button is clicked. Caption button is button displayed on bars with grab handle style task pane.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.DockTabClosing
member.summary: Occurs on dockable bars when end-user attempts to close the individual DockContainerItem objects using system buttons on dock tab. Event can be canceled by setting the Cancel property of event arguments to true. This even will occur only after user presses the X button on tab that is displaying the dockable windows/documents.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.DockTabClosed
member.summary: Occurs on dockable bars after DockContainerItem is closed by end-user. This action cannot be cancelled.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrieve any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.TabStripStyleChanged
member.summary: Occurs after the TabStrip style which used on dockable windows has changed. This event gives you opportunity to change the style of the tab strip by accessing Bar.DockTabControl.Style property.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.PreRender
member.summary: Occurs before the bar control is rendered. This event is fired once for each part of the bar control being rendered. Check the Part property of the event arguments to identify the part being rendered. You can cancel internal rendering by setting Cancel property.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.PostRender
member.summary: Occurs after the bar control is rendered and allows you to render on top of the default rendering provided by the control.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.LocalizeString
member.summary: Occurs when DotNetBar is looking for translated text for one of the internal text that are displayed on menus, toolbars and customize forms. You need to set Handled=true if you want your custom text to be used instead of the built-in system value.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.HotDragDrop
member.summary: Internal use only.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.ReleaseFocus
member.summary: Releases the focus from the bar and selects the control that had focus before bar was selected. If control that had focus could not be determined focus will stay on the bar. This method is used by internal DotNetBar implementation and you should not use it.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.LastFocusControl
member.summary: Returns the reference to the control that last had input focus. This property should be used to determine which control had input focus before bar gained the focus. Use it to apply the menu command to active control.

member.summary: Returns the renderer control will be rendered with.

member.summary: Gets or sets the redering mode used by control. Default value is eRenderMode.Global which means that static GlobalManager.Renderer is used. If set to Custom then Renderer property must also be set to the custom renderer that will be used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.Renderer
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom renderer used by the items on this control. RenderMode property must also be set to eRenderMode.Custom in order renderer specified here to be used.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.RecalcSize
member.summary: Recalculates the layout of the Bar and repaints it. This will not change the size of the Bar it will only force the recalculation of the size for each contained item and it will repaint the bar. To ensure that Bar is resized if necessary as well call RecalcLayout method.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether gray-scale algorithm is used to create automatic gray-scale images. Default is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.DockOffset
member.summary: Gets/Sets the distance from the far left/top side of the docking site or suggests the order of the docked bar. Upon serialization this property will contain actual left/top position of the bar. You can use it to re-order the bars docked on the same line. Property value is relative to the other bars docked on the same line when it is used to change the order. For example setting DockOffset value to 10 will place the bar just after the last bar on the same line that has DockOffset value less than 10. If there is no bar with DockOffset value less than 10 the bar will be placed in first position.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.DockLine
member.summary: Gets/Sets the dock line.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.SetDockLine(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the dock line but it does not forces the Bar to change position. The position will be changed on next layout request or when dock site needs to recalculate the layout of the bat. Used internally only.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.DockTabAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the dock tab alignment.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether close button is displayed on each dock tab that allows closing of the tab. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.AlwaysDisplayDockTab
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab that shows all dock containers on the bar is visible all the time. By default tab is hidden when there is only one item displayed.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar.AlwaysDisplayKeyAccelerators
member.summary: Gets or sets whether accelerator letters for menu or toolbar commands are underlined regardless of current Windows settings. Accelerator keys allow easy access to menu commands by using Alt + choosen key (letter). Default value is false which indicates that system setting is used to determine whether accelerator letters are underlined. Setting this property to true will always display accelerator letter underlined.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BarUtilities.UseGenericDefaultStringFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets whether StringFormat internally used by all DotNetBar controls to render text is GenericDefault. Default value is false which indicates that GenericTypographic is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BarUtilities.AntiAliasTextRenderingHint
member.summary: Gets or sets the anti-alias text rendering hint that will be used to render text on controls that have AntiAlias property set to true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BarUtilities.UseTextRenderer
member.summary: Gets or sets whether .NET Framework TextRenderer class is used for text rendering instead of Graphics.DrawString. Default value is false. Using TextRenderer will disable the Fade and Animation effects on controls because of issues in TextRenderer when drawing text on transparent surfaces.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BarUtilities.AlwaysGenerateAccessibilityFocusEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets whether items always generate the Focus accessibility event when mouse enters the item. Default value is false which indicates that focus event will be raised only when item is on menu bar.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BarUtilities.AutoRemoveMessageFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Application Message Filter that is registered by popup controls is automatically unregistered when last control is disposed. Default value is false and in most cases should not be changed.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BarUtilities.TextMarkupCultureSpecificPadding
member.summary: Get or sets the text-markup padding for text measurement when running on Japanese version of Windows.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BarUtilities.DisposeItemImages
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Image and Icon resources assigned to items and controls are automatically disposed when control or item is disposed. Default value is false.

member.summary: Disposes image reference and sets it to null.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BarUtilities.DisposeImage(System.Drawing.Icon@)
member.summary: Disposes image reference and sets it to null.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.CustomColorName
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom color name. Name specified here must be represented by the corresponding object with the same name that is part of the Office2007ColorTable.RibbonTabItemColors collection. See documentation for Office2007ColorTable.RibbonTabItemColors for more information. If color table with specified name cannot be found default color will be used. Valid settings for this property override any setting to the Color property. Applies to items with Office 2007 style only.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.ColorTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined color of the button. Color specified applies to buttons with Office 2007 style only. It does not have any effect on other styles. Default value is eButtonColor.Default

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.ButtonStyle
member.summary: Gets/Sets the button style which controls the appearance of the button elements. Changing the property can display image only, text only or image and text on the button at all times.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.AutoExpandOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will auto-expand when clicked. When item is on top level bar and not on menu and contains sub-items, sub-items will be shown only if user click the expand part of the button. Setting this propert to true will expand the button and show sub-items when user clicks anywhere inside of the button. Default value is false which indicates that button is expanded only if its expand part is clicked.

member.summary: Indicates whether the button will auto-expand when clicked. When button contains sub-items, sub-items will be shown only if user click the expand part of the button. member.summary: Gets or sets the custom color name. Name specified here must be represented by the corresponding object with the same name that is part of the Office2007ColorTable.ButtonItemColors collection. See documentation for Office2007ColorTable.ButtonItemColors for more information. If color table with specified name cannot be found default color will be used. Valid settings for this property override any setting to the Color property. Applies to items with Office 2007 style only.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.ButtonItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by a button with Office 2007 style. The collection by default has elements that are created to represents the members of eButtonColor enumeration. The name of each color table object is the same as the string enum representation. You can add custom members to this collection or modify the existing ones. Note that you must specify the unique name for the new color table elements. Name specified there can be used in ButtonItem.CustomColorName property to specify custom color table for an ButtonItem.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.RibbonButtonItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by a button with Office 2007 style when button is on RibbonBar control. When collection is empty the values from the ButtonItemColors collections are used instead.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.MenuButtonItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by a button with Office 2007 style when button is on menu bar. When collection is empty the values from the ButtonItemColors collections are used instead.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.ApplicationButtonColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by Ribbon Application Menu Button in Office 2010 style.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.BackstageButtonItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by buttons that are on Backstage tab-strip.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.NavigationPaneButtonItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by buttons that are on NavigationPane control. Currently used for Office 2010 style only. When empty ButtonItemColors is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.RibbonTabItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007RibbonTabItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by a ribbon tab with Office 2007 style. The collection by default has elements that are created to represents the members of eRibbonTabColor enumeration. The name of each color table object is the same as the string enum representation. You can add custom members to this collection or modify the existing ones. Note that you must specify the unique name for the new color table elements. Name specified there can be used in RibbonTabItem.CustomColorName property to specify custom color table for an ButtonItem.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.RibbonTabGroupColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007RibbonTabGroupColorTableCollection objects the describe colors used by a ribbon tab groups with Office 2007 style. The collection by default has elements that are created to represents the members of eRibbonTabGroupColor enumeration. The name of each color table object is the same as the string enum representation. You can add custom members to this collection or modify the existing ones. Note that you must specify the unique name for the new color table elements.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.ItemGroup

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.AutoExpandOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the button will auto-expand when clicked. When button contains sub-items, sub-items will be shown only if user click the expand part of the button. Setting this property to true will expand the button and show sub-items when user clicks anywhere inside of the button. Default value is false which indicates that button is expanded only if its expand part is clicked.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.Checked
member.summary: Gets or set a value indicating whether the button is in the checked state.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.ColorScheme
member.summary: Gets or sets button Color Scheme. ColorScheme does not apply to Office2007 styled buttons.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.ColorTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined color of the button. Color specified applies to buttons with Office 2007 style only. It does not have any effect on other styles. Default value is eButtonColor.BlueWithBackground

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.CustomColorName
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom color name. Name specified here must be represented by the corresponding object with the same name that is part of the Office2007ColorTable.ButtonItemColors collection. See documentation for Office2007ColorTable.ButtonItemColors for more information. If color table with specified name cannot be found default color will be used. Valid settings for this property override any setting to the Color property. Applies to items with Office 2007 style only.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.DisabledImage
member.summary: Specifies the image for the button when items Enabled property is set to false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.EnableMarkup
member.summary: Gets or sets whether text-markup support is enabled for items Text property. Default value is true. Set this property to false to display HTML or other markup in the item instead of it being parsed as text-markup.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the control can respond to user interaction

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.HotTrackingStyle
member.summary: Indicates the way button is rendering the mouse over state. Setting the value to Color will render the image in gray-scale when mouse is not over the item.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.HoverImage
member.summary: Specifies the image for the button when mouse is over the item.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.Image
member.summary: Specifies the Button image.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.ImageFixedSize
member.summary: Sets fixed size of the image. Image will be scaled and painted it size specified.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.ShouldSerializeImageFixedSize
member.summary: Gets whether ImageFixedSize property should be serialized.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.ImagePosition
member.summary: Gets/Sets the image position inside the button.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.ImageTextSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of spacing between button image if specified and text.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.PopupSide
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of popup in relation to it's parent.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.PressedImage
member.summary: Specifies the image for the button when mouse left button is pressed.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.Shape
member.summary: Gets or sets an shape descriptor for the button which describes the shape of the button. Default value is null which indicates that system default shape is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.ShowSubItems
member.summary: Gets or sets whether button displays the expand part that indicates that button has popup.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewButtonXColumn.SplitButton
member.summary: Gets or sets whether button appears as split button. Split button appearance divides button into two parts. Image which raises the click event when clicked and text and expand sign which shows button sub items on popup menu when clicked. Button must have both text and image visible (ButtonStyle property) in order to appear as a full split button.

member.summary: Gets/Sets the visual style for the button.

member.summary: Returns the collection of sub items.

member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the expand part of the button item.

member.summary: Gets or sets the default Text to display on the Button

member.summary: Gets or sets the text alignment. Applies only when button text is not composed using text markup. Default value is center.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether empty null/nothing state of the control is allowed. Default value is true which means that IsEmpty property may return true if input value is resets or ValueObject set to null/nothing.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.AutoAdvance
member.summary: Gets or sets whether input focus is automatically advanced to next input field when input is complete in current one.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.AutoSelectDate
member.summary: Gets or sets whether first day in month is automatically selected on popup date picker when month or year is changed.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.AutoOverwrite
member.summary: Gets or sets whether auto-overwrite functionality for input is enabled. When in auto-overwrite mode input field will erase existing entry and start new one if typing is continued after InputComplete method is called.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.DefaultInputValues
member.summary: Gets or sets whether empty input values (year, month or day) are set to defaults while user is entering data. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the control can respond to user interaction

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the format date/time is displayed in. To specify custom format set this value to Custom and specify custom format using CustomFormat property.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.InputHorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the input field alignment inside the control

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.IsInputReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether input part of the control is read-only. When set to true the input part of the control becomes read-only and does not allow the typing. However, drop-down part if visible still allows user to change the value of the control. Use this property to allow change of the value through drop-down picker only.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.LockUpdateChecked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether check box shown using ShowCheckBox property which locks/unlocks the control update is checked.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.MaxDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum date and time that can be selected in the control.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.ShouldSerializeMaxDate
member.summary: Gets whether Value property should be serialized by Windows Forms designer.
member.returns: true if value serialized otherwise false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.MinDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum date and time that can be selected in the control.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.ShouldSerializeMinDate
member.summary: Gets whether Value property should be serialized by Windows Forms designer.
member.returns: true if value serialized otherwise false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.MonthCalendar
member.summary: Gets the reference to the internal MonthCalendarItem control which is used to display calendar when drop-down is open.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.SelectNextInputCharacters
member.summary: List of characters that when pressed would select next input field. For example if you are allowing time input you could set this property to : so when user presses the : character, the input is forwarded to the next input field.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.ShowCheckBox
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a check box is displayed to the left of the input value. Set to true if a check box is displayed to the left of the input value; otherwise, false. The default is false.
When the ShowCheckBox property is set to true, a check box is displayed to the left of the input in the control. When the check box is selected, the value can be updated. When the check box is cleared, the value is unable to be changed. You can handle the LockUpdateChanged event to be notified when this check box is checked and unchecked. Use LockUpdateChecked property to get or sets whether check box is checked.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDateTimeInputColumn.ShowUpDown
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a spin button control (up-down control) is used to adjust the current value. The default is false.
When the ShowUpDown property is set to true, a spin button control is shown to adjust value of currently focused input item. The value can be adjusted by using the up and down buttons to change the value.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDoubleInputColumn.DisplayFormat
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Numeric String Format that is used to format the numeric value entered for display purpose. Read more about available formats in MSDN under "Standard Numeric Format Strings" and "Custom Numeric Format Strings" topics.
The format specified here indicates the format for display purpose only, not for the input purpose. For example to display the number in system Currency format set the DisplayFormat to 'C'.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDoubleInputColumn.MaxValue

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDoubleInputColumn.MinValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value that can be entered.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDoubleInputColumn.ShowCheckBox
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a check box is displayed to the left of the input value. Set to true if a check box is displayed to the left of the input value; otherwise, false. The default is false.
When the ShowCheckBox property is set to true, a check box is displayed to the left of the input in the control. When the check box is selected, the value can be updated. When the check box is cleared, the value is unable to be changed. You can handle the LockUpdateChanged event to be notified when this check box is checked and unchecked. Use LockUpdateChecked property to get or sets whether check box is checked.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.DataGridViewDoubleInputColumn.ShowUpDown
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a spin button control (up-down control) is used to adjust the current value. The default is false.
When the ShowUpDown property is set to true, a spin button control is shown to adjust value of currently focused input item. The value can be adjusted by using the up and down buttons to change the value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the character to be displayed in substitute for user input.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.PromptChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the character used to represent the absence of user input in MaskedTextBox. Returns character used to prompt the user for input. The default is an underscore (_).

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.ReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether text in control is read only. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.RejectInputOnFirstFailure
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the parsing of user input should stop after the first invalid character is reached. Returns true if processing of the input string should be terminated at the first parsing error; otherwise, false if processing should ignore all errors. The default is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.ResetOnPrompt
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how an input character that matches the prompt character should be handled. Returns true if the prompt character entered as input causes the current editable position in the mask to be reset; otherwise, false to indicate that the prompt character is to be processed as a normal input character. The default is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Controls.MaskedTextBoxAdv.ResetOnSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how a space input character should be handled. Returns true if the space input character causes the current editable position in the mask to be reset; otherwise, false to indicate that it is to be processed as a normal input character. The default is true.

member.summary: Indicates to control that all further update operations should not result in layout and refresh of control content. Use this method to optimize the addition of new items to the control. This method supports nested calls meaning that multiple calls are allowed but they must be ended with appropriate number of EndUpdate calls. IsUpdateSuspended property returns whether update is suspended.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Metro.MetroShell.QatFrequentCommands
member.summary: Gets the collection of the Quick Access Toolbar Frequently used commands. You should add existing buttons to this collection that you already have on the MetroToolbar controls or on the application menu. The list will be used to construct the frequently used menu that is displayed when Customize Quick Access Toolbar menu is displayed and it allows end-user to remove and add these frequently used commands to the QAT directly from this menu. Note that items you add here should not be items that are already on Quick Access Toolbar, i.e. in MetroShell.QuickToolbarItems collection.

Default value is false which indicates that button is expanded only if its expand part is clicked.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPopupCloseEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the closing of the ribbon menu is canceled.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPopupCloseEventArgs.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the source object that was cause of the menu closing. For example this could be reference to an item that was clicked. Default value is null which indicates that there is no information about the object that caused closing available.

remarks.para: Following is the possible list of types that this property could be set to and causes for closing:

list.item: BaseItem - when an item is clicked the Source will be set to the instance of the item that was clicked.
RibbonControl - when parent form RibbonControl is on loses the input focus the Source will be set to the RibbonControl

RibbonTabItem - when tab menu is displayed and user clicks the same tab to close the menu. The RibbonTabItem with EventSource=Code will be also set as source when user double-clicks the tab to maximize the ribbon.
Any other type if RibbonControl.PopupRibbon method is called by your code.

member.summary: Gets or sets the source of the event.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of the item. When used please note that layout logic for dockable windows expects that all DockContainerItems that are in particular docking side have exact same minimum size. When setting this property it is best to set the same value for all DockContainerItem instances you create.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DocumentDockUIManager.SetBarWidth(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the width of the bar that is managed by this document layout. Width can be set only if parent container has Horizontal orientation. Note that bar minimum size is respected by this method and it will be enforced. If width is less than minimum width bar's width will be set to minimum width.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DocumentDockUIManager.SetBarHeight(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the height of the bar that is managed by this document layout. Height can be set only if parent container has vertical orientation. Note that bar minimum size is respected by this method and it will be enforced. If height is less than minimum height bar's height will be set to minimum height.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DockTabClosing
member.summary: Occurs on dockable bars when end-user attempts to close the individual DockContainerItem objects using system buttons on dock tab. Event can be canceled by setting the Cancel property of event arguments to true. This even will occur only after user presses the X button on tab that is displaying the dockable windows/documents.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DockTabClosed
member.summary: Occurs on dockable bars after DockContainerItem is closed. This action cannot be cancelled.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrieve any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.TextBoxItemTextChanged
member.summary: Occurs when TextBoxItem input text has changed.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ColorPickerSelectedColorChanged
member.summary: Occurs when color on ColorPickerDropDown is choosen from drop-down color picker or from Custom Colors dialog box. Selected color can be accessed through SelectedColor property.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ButtonCheckedChanged
member.summary: Occurs when Checked property of an button has changed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Context menu bar associated with the this control which is used as part of Global Items feature. The context menu bar assigned here will be used to search for the items with the same Name or GlobalName property so global properties can be propagated when changed. member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.MinimumClientSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum client size that docking windows will try to maintain for the client area (not occupied by dock windows). Note that this value is suggested value and cannot be observed when form is resized below the minimum size required for the given layout. Default value is 48x48 pixels.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ShouldSerializeMinimumClientSize
member.summary: Returns whether property should be serialized by Windows Forms designer.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DockingHintsEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether DotNetBar provides docking hints for easy docking of bars.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.EnableFullSizeDock
member.summary: Gets or sets whether user can control how first bar is docked when using docking hints (default value is True). When enabled (default value) placing the mouse over the middle docking hint will dock the bar at partial size and using the far docking hint will dock bar at full size. Full size indicates that dock site which hosts the bar consumes all the space of the parent form while partial size indicates that dock site consumes the full size minus the space of the other dock sites. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ApplyDocumentBarStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets whether uniform styling is applied to bars docked as documents. Default value is true which means that bar that will be docked as document will have it's style changed so it fits in default document styling. Such bars will have GrabHandleStyle=None, DockTabAlignment=Top and AlwaysDisplayDockTab=true. Set this property to false to have bars keep these properties once they are docked as documents. Value of these properties will be returned back to the default values once bar is not docked as document.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.RemoveBar(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Bar)
member.summary: Use to remove bar from DotNetBar control. Bar will be undocked if it is docked and removed from all internal collections.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.Bars
member.summary: Gets the collection of the Bar objects associated with DotNetBarManager.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ForceDefinitionLoad
member.summary: Forces the loading of the definition specified in DefinitionName property. By default definition is loaded after parent form handle has been created and form is loaded. However, under certain circumstances you might need DotNetBar to load definition right away so you can access bars and items. We recommend moving the code to Form Load event and leaving the loading process for DotNetBar definition as is.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.IsDefinitionLoaded

member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of shortcut keys that are automatically dispatched to the control that has focus even if they are handled and used by one of the items. This gives you fine control over which shortcuts are passed through the system and which ones are marked as handled by DotNetBar.

member.summary: Returns whether definition is being currently loaded.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.IncludeDockDocumentsInDefinition
member.summary: Gets or sets whether document bars are saved in definition file. Default value is false which means that document bars are not saved as part of definition file. You can set this value to true to save document bar to definition file and be able to load them.
member.remarks: Note that by default Document bars that you created during design-time get member variables assigned to them by Windows Forms designer. If you decide to save definition of such bars and load definition back member variables will not point to correct bar instances since loading definition recreates all bars from scratch. You should always use Bars collection to access bars when saving and loading definitions.

member.summary: Gets or sets Color scheme for all bars. Note that you need to set UseGlobalColorScheme to true to indicate that this ColorScheme object will be used on all bars managed by this instance of DotNetBarManager.

member.summary: Resets the ColorScheme property to its default value.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.UseGlobalColorScheme
member.summary: Gets or sets whether ColorScheme object on DotNetBarManager is used as a default ColorScheme for all bars managed by DotNetBarManager. Default value is false which indicates that ColorScheme on each Bar is used. When set to true each bar will use the ColorScheme settings from DotNetBarManager and it will ignore any setting on the Bar.ColorScheme object.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.AlwaysShowFullMenus
member.summary: Indicates whether the Personalized menu setting is ignored and full menus are always shown.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.AlwaysDisplayKeyAccelerators
member.summary: Gets or sets whether accelerator letters for menu or toolbar commands are underlined regardless of current Windows settings. Accelerator keys allow easy access to menu commands by using Alt + choosen key (letter). Default value is false which indicates that system setting is used to determine whether accelerator letters are underlined. Setting this property to true will always display accelerator letter underlined.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.IsThemeActive

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.BackColorSchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme color that is used as background color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding BackColor property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor property.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.ApplyFontStyle(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ElementStyle)
member.summary: Applies a "child/inherited" style text and box properties but not any background or border properties to this style. Use this method to create style hierarchies.
member.param: Style to apply to this style

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.ApplyStyle(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ElementStyle)
member.summary: Applies a "child/inherited" style to this style. Use this method to create style hierarchies.
member.remarks: This method is used to support style hierarchies where a base style is defined and inherited/child styles are derived and based on it. By using this method on the base style you can apply only style changes defined by the child style. For example if you defined a base style for normal user interface element then in most cases you do not want to redefine the styling for the case when same user interface element is selected. You will just defined the behavior of the selected state and then apply it to the base normal style using ApplyStyle method.
member.param: Style to apply to current style.

member.summary: Resets BackgroundColor to it's default value. Used by windows forms designer design-time support.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.BackColorSchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme color that is used as background color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding BackColor property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor property.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrieve any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.SuspendLayoutDisplay
member.summary: Suspends the layout and painting of the control. When you want to perform multiple operations on the explorer bar and you want to ensure that layout of the items on it and painting is not performed for performance and appearance reasons set this property to true. Once you want to enable layout and painting set the property back to false and call RecalcLayout method. Default value is false.

member.summary: Specifies custom image to be used as button on ExplorerBarGroup item to collapse the group. This Image is used when left mouse button is pressed while cursor is over the button. Default value is null which indicates that default button is used.

member.name: T:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization
member.summary: Desribes interface that provides custom serialization support for items.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrieve any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.summary: Invokes SerializeItem event.

member.summary: Invokes DeserializeItem event.

member.summary: Gets whether any handlers have been defined for SerializeItem event. If no handles have been defined to optimize performance SerializeItem event will not be attempted to fire.

member.summary: Gets whether any handlers have been defined for DeserializeItem event. If no handles have been defined to optimize performance DeserializeItem event will not be attempted to fire.

member.summary: Loads navigation bar layout that was saved using SaveLayout method. Note that this method must be called after all items are created and added to the control.

member.summary: Saves current visual layout of navigation bar control to XmlElement.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.LayoutDefinition
member.summary: Gets or sets the navigation bar definition string.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.AntiAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets whether anti-alias smoothing is used while painting. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.AnimationTime
member.summary: Gets or sets animation time in milliseconds when control is expanded or collapsed. Default value is 100 miliseconds. You can set this to 0 (zero) to disable animation.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.CanCollapse
member.summary: Gets or sets whether navigation pane can be collapsed. Default value is false. When set to true expand/collapse button will be displayed in title so control can be reduced in size.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.TitleButtonAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets alignment of the expand button inside of title bar.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets whether navigation pane is expanded. Default value is true. When control is collapsed it is reduced in size so it consumes less space.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.CollapsedInnerPanel
member.summary: Gets the reference to the inner panel displaying Navigation Pane vertical text created when control is collapsed.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.PopupSelectedPane
member.summary: Popup selected pane when control is collapsed. When control is collapsed (Expanded=false) currently selected pane is not visible calling this method will popup selected pane and allow user access to it. Use PopupPaneVisible property to check whether currently selected pane is displayed as popup.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.HideSelectedPopupPane
member.summary: Hides popup selected pane when control is collapsed and selected pane is displayed as popup. When control is collapsed (Expanded=false) currently selected pane can be displayed as popup. Calling this method will hide the popup pane. Use PopupPaneVisible property to check whether currently selected pane is displayed as popup.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.OnPanelPopupClosed(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the PanelPopupClosed event.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.PopupSelectedPaneVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether selected pane is displayed as popup when control is collapsed (Expanded=false). Using navigation pane button that is displayed when control is collapsed user can popup or close currently selected pane without expanding the control. You can use this property to do same from code as well as check whether selected pane is displayed as popup. Note that control must be collapsed (Expanded=false) in order for this property to have any effect.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.LoadLayout(System.String)
member.summary: Loads navigation bar layout that was saved using SaveLayout method. Note that this method must be called after all items are created and added to the control.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.LoadLayout(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Loads navigation bar layout that was saved using SaveLayout method. Note that this method must be called after all items are created and added to the control.
member.param: Parent XML element that is used to load layout from. Note that this must be the same element that was passed into the SaveLayout method.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.LayoutOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets orientation inside the container. GalleryContainer automatically manages the layout orientation and this property should not be changed from its default value.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.HorizontalItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the item alignment when container is in horizontal layout. Default value is Left.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.VerticalItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the item vertical alignment. Default value is Top.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.MultiLine
member.summary: Gets or sets whether items in horizontal layout are wrapped into the new line when they cannot fit allotted container size. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.ResizeItemsToFit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether items contained by container are resized to fit the container bounds. When container is in horizontal layout mode then all items will have the same height. When container is in vertical layout mode then all items will have the same width. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.PopupUsesStandardScrollbars
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Gallery when on popup is using standard scrollbars to scroll the content. Standard scrollbars are displayed on right hand side of the Gallery. Default value for this property is true. When set to false the scroll buttons are displayed only when needed and two buttons on top and bottom of the Gallery are used to indicate the scrolling possibility and enable scrolling. Buttons are only visible when needed. This scrolling button style can be used for example on Application Menu to enable scrolling of list of most recently used files.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.IncrementalSizing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether gallery is using incremental sizing when stretched. Default value is true. Incremental sizing will resize the width of the gallery so it fits completely the items it can contain in available space. That means that gallery will occupy enough space to display the whole items within available space. When set to false, it indicates that gallery will resize to fill all available space.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.StretchGallery
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Gallery width is determined based on the RibbonBar width. This property is in effect when Gallery is hosted directly the RibbonBar control. Default value is false. When set to true the Gallery size is changed as the RibbonBar control is resized. The initial size of the Gallery is determined by DefaultSize property. The MinimumSize property specifies the minimum size of the Gallery. Note that only single Gallery can be stretched per RibbonBar control.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.PopupGalleryItems
member.summary: Gets the collection of the items that are added to the popup gallery. The items displayed on the gallery are combined with the items from this collection and they are displayed on the gallery popup. This collection can for example have items that are customizing the choices of the commands in gallery etc.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.DefaultSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the default size of the gallery. The gallery height will be always enforced so all scroll buttons can be displayed. Gallery width should allow display of both scroll buttons and the gallery content.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.ShouldSerializeDefaultSize
member.summary: Gets whether DefaultSize property is serialized by Windows Forms designer based on its current value.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.ResetDefaultSize
member.summary: Resets DefaultSize property to its default value.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.PopupGallerySize
member.summary: Gets or sets the default size of the gallery when gallery is displayed on the popup menu.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.ShouldSerializePopupGallerySize
member.summary: Gets whether PopupGallerySize property is serialized by Windows Forms designer based on its current value.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.ResetPopupGallerySize
member.summary: Resets PopupGallerySize property to its default value.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.EnableGalleryPopup
member.summary: Gets or sets whether gallery can be displayed on the popup. Default value is true.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.EnsureVisible(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.BaseItem)
member.summary: Scrolls the gallery if necessary to ensures that item is visible.
member.param: Reference to the items that is part of the gallery.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.ScrollDown
member.summary: Scrolls gallery down to show next line of items.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.ScrollUp
member.summary: Scrolls gallery up to show previous line of items.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item is expanded or not. For Popup items this would indicate whether the item is popped up or not.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.IsGalleryPopupOpen
member.summary: Gets whether the Gallery popup is open.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.PopupGallery
member.summary: Opens the Gallery popup menu.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.KeyTips
member.summary: Gets or sets the Key Tips access key or keys for the item when on Ribbon Control or Ribbon Bar. Use KeyTips property when you want to assign the one or more letters to be used to access an item. For example assigning the FN to KeyTips property will require the user to press F then N keys to select an item. Pressing the F letter will show only keytips for the items that start with letter F.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.ScrollAnimation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether scroll animation is enabled. Default value is true. Scroll animation will be disabled if gallery is running under Remote Windows Terminal session or fade animation effect is disabled on the container control.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.CanExtend(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns whether Gallery can extend the object.
member.returns: Returns true if object can be extended otherwise false.

member.summary: Gets the GalleryGroup item is assigned to.
member.returns: An instance of GalleryGroup object or null if item is not assigned to the group

member.summary: Assigns the item to the gallery group.
member.param: Group to assign item to. Can be null to remove item assignment.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.GalleryGroups
member.summary: Gets the collection of GalleryGroup objects associated with this gallery. Groups are assigned optionally to one or more items that are part of the GalleryContainer. Groups are used to visually group the items when gallery is displayed on the popup.

member.name: T:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.GalleryGroup
member.summary: Represents the popup gallery group that groups set of items inside of gallery into the group.

Use KeyTips property when you want to assign the one or more letters to be used to access an item. For example assigning the FN to KeyTips property will require the user to press F then N keys to select an item. Pressing the F letter will show only keytips for the items that start with letter F.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemControl.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Indicates to control that all further update operations should not result in layout and refresh of control content. Use this method to optimize the addition of new items to the control. This method supports nested calls meaning that multiple calls are allowed but they must be ended with appropriate number of EndUpdate calls. IsUpdateSuspended property returns whether update is suspended.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ItemControl.EndUpdate
member.summary: Indicates that update operation is complete and that control should perform layout and refresh to show changes. See BeginUpdate for more details.

member.summary: Closes the RibbonBar overflow popup if control is in overflow mode and displays the overflow popup that shows complete content of the control.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Accessible name for the Dialog Launcher button

member.summary: Specifies the background style of the control when mouse is over the control. Style specified here will be applied to the BackgroundStyle.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.ResetBackgroundMouseOverStyle
member.summary: Resets style to default value. Used by windows forms designer.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.DialogLauncherButton
member.summary: Gets or sets image that is used as dialog luncher button in ribbon title bar. Default value is null which indicates that default appearance for the button is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.DialogLauncherMouseOverButton
member.summary: Gets or sets image that is used as dialog luncher button when mouse is over the button. Note that if this property is set you also must set the DialogLauncherButton property. Images set to both properties must have same size. Default value is null which indicates that default appearance for the button is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.MaximumOverflowTextLength
member.summary: Gets or sets maximum text length for automatic overflow button text. When overflow button is created due to the reduced size of the control text for the button can be specified using OverflowButtonText property. If text is not specified RibbonBar.Text property is used as overflow button text. In that case this property specifies maximum length of the text to display on the button. Default value is 25. You can set this property to 0 to use complete text regardless of length.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.ResizeOrderIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets resize order index of the control. When control is parented to RibbonPanel control (which is the case when control is used as part of RibbonControl) index specified here indicates the order in which controls that are part of the same panel are resized. Lower index value indicates that control should be resized later when size needs to be reduced or earlier when size needs to be increased. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.AutoOverflowEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether automatic overflow handling is enabled. When overflow is enabled if control is resized below the size that is needed to display its complete content overflow button is created and all content is moved to the overflow button popup. Control will only display overflow button when in this state and user can click overflow button to display the actual content of the control. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.OverflowButtonText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text for overflow button that is created when ribbon bar size is reduced so it cannot display all its content. When control is resized so it cannot display its content overflow button is created which is displayed on face of the control. Complete content of the control is then displayed on popup toolbar when user clicks overflow button.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.OverflowButtonImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the Image for overflow button that is created when ribbon bar size is reduced so it cannot display all its content. When control is resized so it cannot display its content overflow button is created which is displayed on face of the control. Complete content of the control is then displayed on popup toolbar when user clicks overflow button. This Image is also used when RibbonBar is added to the Quick Access Toolbar to identify the RibbonBar button.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.DoLaunchDialog
member.summary: Invokes the LaunchDialog event to execute default launch dialog action.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.DialogLauncherVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether dialog launcher button is visible in title of the ribbon. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.LayoutOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets default layout orientation inside the control. You can have multiple layouts inside of the control by adding one or more instances of the ItemContainer object and changing it's LayoutOrientation property.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.ItemSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets spacing in pixels between items. Default value is 1.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.ResizeItemsToFit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether items contained by container are resized to fit the container bounds. When container is in horizontal layout mode then all items will have the same height. When container is in vertical layout mode then all items will have the same width. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.HorizontalItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the item alignment when container is in horizontal layout. Default value is Left.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.VerticalItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the item vertical alignment. Default value is Top.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.ResetCachedContentSize
member.summary: Resets cached content size. Content size is cached to improve performance of the control when control is switched into overflow mode displaying a single button. If you change content of Rendering, hide/show items or add new items you will need to call this method to erase cached value and allow the full Rendering size to be calculated.

member.summary: Occurs before the RibbonBar objects from container are merged into the Ribbon control.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBarMergeContainer.AutoActivateTab
member.summary: Gets or sets whether RibbonTab item the RibbonBar controls are added to when merged is automatically activated (selected) after controls are merged. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBarMergeContainer.AllowMerge
member.summary: Gets or sets whether merge functionality is enabled for the container. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBarMergeContainer.RibbonTabText
member.summary: Gets or sets the Ribbon Tab text for the tab that will be created when ribbon bar objects from this container are merged into the ribbon.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBarMergeContainer.RibbonTabKeyTips
member.summary: Gets or sets the Key Tips access key or keys for the Ribbon Tab. Use KeyTips property when you want to assign the one or more letters to be used to access an item. For example assigning the FN to KeyTips property will require the user to press F then N keys to select an item. Pressing the F letter will show only keytips for the items that start with letter F.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBarMergeContainer.RibbonTabColorTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined color for the ribbon tab that is created when ribbon bar controls are merged into the ribbon. Default value is eRibbonTabColor.Default

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBarMergeContainer.MergeIntoRibbonTabItemName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of RibbonTabItem object that already exists on Ribbon control into which the RibbonBar controls are merged. If name is not specified new RibbonTabItem is created and RibbonBar controls are added to it.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBarMergeContainer.MergeRibbonGroupName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the RibbonTabItemGroup the new Ribbon Tab Item that is created will be added to. The RibbonTabItemGroup must be created and added to RibbonControl.TabGroups collection.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonBarMergeContainer.MergeRibbonTabItemIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the insertion index for the ribbon tab item that is created when ribbon bars are merged into the ribbon control. Default value is -1 which means that ribbon tab item is appended to the existing ribbon tab items.

member.summary: Occurs just before the customize popup menu is displayed and provides the ability to cancel the menu display as well as to add/remove the menu items from the customize popup menu.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.BeforeAddItemToQuickAccessToolbar
member.summary: Occurs before an item is added to the quick access toolbar as result of user action. This event provides ability to cancel the addition of the item by setting the Cancel=true of event arguments.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.BeforeRemoveItemFromQuickAccessToolbar
member.summary: Occurs before an item is removed from the quick access toolbar as result of user action. This event provides ability to cancel the addition of the item by setting the Cancel=true of event arguments.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.LocalizeString
member.summary: Occurs when DotNetBar is looking for translated text for one of the internal text that are displayed on menus, toolbars and customize forms. You need to set Handled=true if you want your custom text to be used instead of the built-in system value.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.ItemClick
member.summary: Occurs when Item on ribbon tab strip or quick access toolbar is clicked.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.BeforeQatCustomizeDialog
member.summary: Occurs before Quick Access Toolbar dialog is displayed. This event provides the opportunity to cancel the showing of built-in dialog and display custom customization dialog. You can also set the Dialog property of the event arguments to the custom dialog you want used instead of the DotNetBar system customization dialog.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AfterQatCustomizeDialog
member.summary: Occurs after the Quick Access Toolbar dialog is closed.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.QatFrequentCommands
member.summary: Gets the collection of the Quick Access Toolbar Frequently used commands. You should add existing buttons to this collection that you already have on the RibbonBar controls or on the application menu. The list will be used to construct the frequently used menu that is displayed when Customize Quick Access Toolbar menu is displayed and it allows end-user to remove and add these frequently used commands to the QAT directly from this menu. Note that items you add here should not be items that are already on Quick Access Toolbar, i.e. in RibbonControl.QuickToolbarItems collection.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.GlobalContextMenuBar
member.summary: Gets or sets the Context menu bar associated with the this control which is used as part of Global Items feature. The context menu bar assigned here will be used to search for the items with the same Name or GlobalName property so global properties can be propagated when changed. You should assign this property to enable the Global Items feature to reach your ContextMenuBar.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CaptionVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether custom caption and quick access toolbar provided by the control is visible. Default value is false. This property should be set to true when control is used on Office2007RibbonForm.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CaptionFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font for the form caption text when CaptionVisible=true. Default value is NULL which means that system font is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CaptionHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the explicit height of the caption provided by control. Caption height when set is composed of the TabGroupHeight and the value specified here. Default value is 0 which means that system default caption size is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.RibbonStripIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indent of the ribbon strip. The indent setting is useful when control is used with caption visible and the Office 2007 style start button. The indent specified here will move the ribbon strip so the start button does not overlap the tabs. Value of this property is used only when CaptionVisible = true. Default value is 46.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.RibbonStripFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font used by the ribbon strip.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.FadeEffect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether mouse over fade effect is enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.KeyTipsFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font that is used to display Key Tips (accelerator keys) when they are displayed. Default value is null which means that control Font is used for Key Tips display.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.TabGroups
member.summary: Collection of RibbonTabItemGroup items. Groups are assigned optionally to one or more RibbonTabItem object through the RibbonTabItem.Group property to visually group tabs that belong to same functions. These tabs should be positioned next to each other.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.TabGroupHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height in pixels of tab group line that is displayed above the RibbonTabItem objects that have group assigned. Default value is 10 pixels. To show tab groups you need to assign the RibbonTabItem.Group property and set TabGroupsVisible=true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.TabGroupsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab group line that is displayed above the RibbonTabItem objects that have group assigned is visible. Default value is false. To show tab groups you need to assign the RibbonTabItem.Group property and set TabGroupsVisible=true. Use TabGroupHeight property to control height of the group line.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.DefaultGroupFont
member.summary: Gets or sets default font for tab groups. This font will be used if font is not specified by group style element.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.ResetDefaultGroupFont
member.summary: Resets DefaultGroupFont property to default value null.

member.summary: Specifies the background style of the control.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CanCustomize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control can be customized and items added by end-user using context menu to the quick access toolbar. Caption of the control must be visible for customization to be enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.UseExternalCustomization
member.summary: Gets or sets whether external implementation for ribbon bar and menu item customization will be used for customizing the ribbon control. When set to true it enables the displaying of RibbonBar and menu item context menus which allow customization. You are responsible for adding the menu items to context menu to handle all aspects of item customization. See "Ribbon Control Quick Access Toolbar Customization" topic in help file under How To. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.EnableQatPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets whether end-user customization of the placement of the Quick Access Toolbar is enabled. User can change the position of the Quick Access Toolbar using the customize menu. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.UseCustomizeDialog
member.summary: Gets or sets whether customize dialog is used to customize the quick access toolbar. You can handle the EnterCustomize event to display your custom dialog instead of built-in dialog for customization. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CategorizeMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the categorization mode for the items on Quick Access Toolbar customize dialog box. Default value categorizes items by the ribbon bar they appear on.

This method is useful for example when switching the color tables for Office 2007 renderer. Once the GlobalManager.Renderer color table is changed you can call this method to apply color table changes to the Ribbon Control and other controls managed by it.
member.param: RibbonControl to set the style on.
