member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeOffice2007ColorTable(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.eOffice2007ColorScheme)
member.summary: Changes the Office 2007 color table for all DotNetBar controls on the open forms that are tracked by Application.OpenForms collection. You can use this function for example to apply Black color scheme to all DotNetBar control on all open forms. The color table will be changed only for controls that have Office 2007 style. Any other style will be unchanged.
member.param: Color table to select and apply.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ApplyOffice2007ColorTable
member.summary: Applies current Office 2007 style color table set on GlobalManager.Renderer to all DotNetBar controls with Office 2007 style on all open forms.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeOffice2007ColorTable(System.Windows.Forms.Control,Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.eOffice2007ColorScheme)
member.summary: Changes the Office 2007 color table for all DotNetBar controls on the form. You can use this function for example to apply Black color scheme to all DotNetBar control on given form. The color table will be changed only for controls that have Office 2007 style. Any other style will be unchanged.
member.param: Form to apply color table to.
Color table to select and apply.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeOffice2007ColorTable(System.Windows.Forms.Control,Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.eOffice2007ColorScheme,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Generates and Changes the Office 2007 color table for all DotNetBar controls on the form. You can use this function for example to create custom color scheme based on the base color and apply it to all DotNetBar control on given form. The new color table will be applied only to controls that have Office 2007 style. Any other style will be unchanged.
member.param: Form to apply color table to.
Base color table to use for creation of custom color table that will be applied.
Base color used to create custom color table.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeOffice2007ColorTable(Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Rendering.eOffice2007ColorScheme,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Generates and Changes the Office 2007 color table for all DotNetBar controls on all open forms. You can use this function for example to create custom color scheme based on the base color and apply it to all DotNetBar control on given form. The new color table will be applied only to controls that have Office 2007 style. Any other style will be unchanged.
member.param: Base color table to use for creation of custom color table that will be applied.
Base color used to create custom color table.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ApplyOffice2007ColorTable(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Applies current Office 2007 style color table to all DotNetBar controls on the form.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether KeyTips functionality is enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.CanCustomize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control can be customized and items added by end-user using context menu to the quick access toolbar. Caption of the control must be visible for customization to be enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.CaptionHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the explicit height of the caption provided by control. Caption height when set is composed of the TabGroupHeight and the value specified here. Default value is 0 which means that system default caption size is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.CaptionVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether custom caption line provided by the control is visible. Default value is false. This property should be set to true when control is used on Office2007RibbonForm.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.CaptionFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font for the form caption text when CaptionVisible=true. Default value is NULL which means that system font is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.RibbonStripIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indent of the ribbon strip. The indent setting is useful when control is used with caption visible and the Office 2007 style start button. The indent specified here will move the ribbon strip so the start button does not overlap the tabs. Value of this property is used only when CaptionVisible = true. Default value is 46.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.TabGroupHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height in pixels of tab group line that is displayed above the RibbonTabItem objects that have group assigned. Default value is 14 pixels. To show tab groups you need to assign the RibbonTabItem.Group property and set TabGroupsVisible=true.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.TabGroupsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab group line that is displayed above the RibbonTabItem objects that have group assigned is visible. Default value is false. To show tab groups you need to assign the RibbonTabItem.Group property and set TabGroupsVisible=true. Use TabGroupHeight property to control height of the group line.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.TabGroups
member.summary: Collection of RibbonTabItemGroup items. Groups are assigned optionally to one or more RibbonTabItem object through the RibbonTabItem.Group property to visually group tabs that belong to same functions. These tabs should be positioned next to each other.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.RibbonTabItem.AutoExpandOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will auto-expand when clicked. When item is on top level bar and not on menu and contains sub-items, sub-items will be shown only if user click the expand part of the button. Setting this propert to true will expand the button and show sub-items when user clicks anywhere inside of the button. Default value is false which indicates that button is expanded only if its expand part is clicked.

member.summary: Gets the reference to internal Hashtable that contains reference to all controls and assigned SuperTooltips. This collection must not be modified directly and it is automatically managed by the SuperTooltip component. You can use it for example to change the color for all SuperTooltips managed by the component but you should not add or remove items to it. Instead use SetSuperTooltip methods to add or remove the tooltip for a component.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SideBar.ToolTipShowing
member.summary: Occurs before tooltip for an item is shown. Sender could be the BaseItem or derived class for which tooltip is being displayed or it could be a ToolTip object itself it tooltip is not displayed for any item in particular.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SideBar.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.SideBar.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrieve any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the tab scrolling is animated.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.AutoHideSystemBox
member.summary: Gets or sets whether system box that enables scrolling and closing of the tabs is automatically hidden when tab items size does not exceed the size of the control.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.CanReorderTabs
member.summary: Specifes whether end-user can reorder the tabs.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.AutoCloseTabs
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab is automatically closed when close button is clicked. Closing the tab will remove tab being closed from Tabs collection and it will remove the panel as well. Default value is false which means that tab will not be closed and you should handle TabClose event to perform desired action as result of user closing the tab.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.CloseButtonVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Close button that closes the active tab is visible on system box.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.CloseButtonOnTabsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether close button is visible on each tab instead of in system box.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.CloseButtonOnTabsAlwaysDisplayed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether close button on tabs when visible is displayed for every tab state. Default value is true. When set to false the close button will be displayed only for selected and tab that mouse is currently over.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.CloseButtonPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the close button displayed on each tab. Default value is Left.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.TabCloseButtonNormal
member.summary: Gets or sets custom image that is used on tabs as Close button that allows user to close the tab. Use TabCloseButtonHot property to specify image that is used when mouse is over the close button. Note that image size must be same for both images. Default value is null which means that internal representation of close button is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.TabCloseButtonHot
member.summary: Gets or sets custom image that is used on tabs as Close button whem mouse is over the close button. To use this property you must set TabCloseButtonNormal as well. Note that image size for both images must be same. Default value is null which means that internal representation of close button is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabControl.DisplaySelectedTextOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether only selected tab is displaying it's text.

member.summary: Gets or sets the image list used by tab items.

member.summary: Gets or sets scrolling offset of the first tab. You can use this property to programmatically scroll the tab strip.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether close button on tabs when visible is displayed for every tab state. Default value is true. When set to false the close button will be displayed only for selected and tab that mouse is currently over.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabStrip.TabCloseButtonNormal
member.summary: Gets or sets custom image that is used on tabs as Close button that allows user to close the tab. Use TabCloseButtonHot property to specify image that is used when mouse is over the close button. Note that image size must be same for both images. Default value is null which means that internal representation of close button is used.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.TabStrip.TabCloseButtonHot
member.summary: Gets or sets custom image that is used on tabs as Close button whem mouse is over the close button. To use this property you must set TabCloseButtonNormal as well. Note that image size for both images must be same. Default value is null which means that internal representation of close button is used.

member.name: T:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ToastNotification
member.summary: Represents class used to display toast notifications. A toast notification is a message that appears on the surface of the screen for a moment, but it does not take focus (or pause the current activity), so it cannot accept any user input. Notification pops up on the surface of the specified Form or Control. It only fills the amount of space required for the message and the user's current activity remains visible and interactive. The notification automatically fades in and out after specified time interval. Notification text supports text-markup.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ToastNotification.Close(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Closes all toast notifications open on specified parent control.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.ToastNotification.Close(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Closes specified toast notification on parent control.
member.param: Toast ID as returned by the Show method.

member.summary: Displays the toast notification on top of the specified parent control, we recommend always using a parent form.
member.param: Parent form to display toast notification on top of
Image to display next to toast text.
Interval in milliseconds after which the notification is hidden.
Specifies the position of the toast notification.

member.summary: Displays the toast notification on top of the specified parent control, we recommend always using a parent form.

Image to display next to toast text.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.Validator.SuperValidator.ContainerControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the container control validator is bound to. The container control must be set for the ValidationType ValidatingEventOnContainer. When ContainerControl is Form the validator handles the Closing event of the form to perform the validation and cancel the form closing. You can disable that by setting either Enabled=false or Form.CausesValidation=false.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Hide
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Normal
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowMinimized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Maximize
member.summary: Maximizes the specified window.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowMaximized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowNoActivate
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to , except the window is not actived.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Show
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Minimize
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowMinNoActive
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to , except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to , except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.Restore
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ShowDefault
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_* value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WinApi.ShowWindowCommands.ForceMinimize
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is not responding. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WinApi.GetWindowPlacement(System.IntPtr,Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.DotNetBar.WinApi.WINDOWPLACEMENT@)
member.summary: Retrieves the show state and the restored, minimized, and maximized positions of the specified window.
member.param:
A pointer to the WINDOWPLACEMENT structure that receives the show state and position information.
Before calling GetWindowPlacement, set the length member to sizeof(WINDOWPLACEMENT). GetWindowPlacement fails if lpwndpl-> length is not set correctly.
member.returns:
If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.summary: Returns a Stack of page history. Each time next page is displayed by wizard, previously visited page is added to the history. When user commands Wizard back, the last page from the history is shown and removed from the stack. You should not modify this collection directly since it is maintained by Wizard control.

member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing in pixels between content blocks. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.UI.ContentManager.SerialContentLayoutManager.FitContainerOversize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether content blocks are forced to fit the container bounds if they occupy more space than it is available by container. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.UI.ContentManager.SerialContentLayoutManager.FitContainer
member.summary: Gets or sets whether content blocks are resized to fit the container bound if they occupy less space than it is available by container. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.UI.ContentManager.SerialContentLayoutManager.VerticalFitContainerWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets whether content blocks are resized (Width) to fit container bounds if they occupy less space than the actual container width. Applies to the Vertical orientation only. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.UI.ContentManager.SerialContentLayoutManager.HorizontalFitContainerHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets whether content blocks are resized (Height) to fit container bounds if they occupy less space than the actual container height. Applies to the Horizontal orientation only. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.UI.ContentManager.SerialContentLayoutManager.ContentOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the content orientation. Default value is Horizontal.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.UI.ContentManager.SerialContentLayoutManager.ContentVerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the content vertical alignment. Default value is Middle.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.UI.ContentManager.SerialContentLayoutManager.BlockLineAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the block line vertical alignment. Default value is Middle.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.UI.ContentManager.SerialContentLayoutManager.ContentAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the content horizontal alignment. Default value is Left.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.UI.ContentManager.SerialContentLayoutManager.EvenHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets whether all content blocks are resized so they have same height which is height of the tallest content block. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.UI.ContentManager.SerialContentLayoutManager.OversizeDistribute
member.summary: Gets or sets whether oversized blocks are resized based on the percentage reduction instead of based on equal pixel distribution. Default value is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether content is wrapped into new line if it exceeds the width of the container.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether layout is right-to-left.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.DateSelected
member.summary:
Occurs when the user makes an explicit date selection using the mouse.
This event is similar to the DateChanged event, but it occurs at the end of a date selection made using the mouse. The DateChanged event occurs during any date selection, whether by mouse, keyboard, or code. You should handle this event when you enable multiple date selection through MultiSelect property and want to be notified after the date selection has been made. DateChanged event would fire each time selection changes during the selection of multiple dates.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of days that can be selected in a month calendar control.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.SelectionStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the start date of the selected range of dates.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.SelectionEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the end date of the selected range of dates.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.SelectionRange
member.summary:
Gets or sets the selected range of dates for a month calendar control.
Setting this property is functionally equivalent to using the SetSelectionRange method. You can set the start and end dates separately by setting either the SelectionStart or SelectionEnd properties. You cannot change the start and end dates by setting the SelectionRange.Start or SelectionRange.End property values of the SelectionRange property. You should use SelectionStart, SelectionEnd, or SetSelectionRange. If the Start property value of the SelectionRange is greater than its End property value, the dates are swapped; the End property value becomes the starting date, and Start property value becomes the end date.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.ShouldSerializeSelectionRange
member.summary: Returns whether property should be serialized by Windows Forms designer.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarAdv.SetSelectionRange(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Sets the selected dates in a month calendar control to the specified date range.
member.param: The beginning date of the selection range.
The end date of the selection range.
member.exception:
startDate is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.
-or-
startDate is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.
-or-
endDate is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.
-or- endDate is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.
member.remarks: If the startDate value is greater than endDate property value, the dates are swapped; the endDate value becomes the starting date, and startDate value becomes the end date.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.ShowCheckBox
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a check box is displayed to the left of the selected date. Set to true if a check box is displayed to the left of the selected date; otherwise, false. The default is false.
When the ShowCheckBox property is set to true, a check box is displayed to the left of the date in the control. When the check box is selected, the date/time value can be updated. When the check box is cleared, the date/time value is unable to be changed. You can handle the LockUpdateChanged event to be notified when this check box is checked and unchecked. Use LockUpdateChecked property to get or sets whether check box is checked.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput._ShowUpDown
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a spin button control (up-down control) is used to adjust the date/time value. The default is false.
When the ShowUpDown property is set to true, a spin button control is shown to adjust value of currently focused input item. The date and time can be adjusted by selecting each element individually and using the up and down buttons to change the value.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the format date/time is displayed in. To specify custom format set this value to Custom and specify custom format using CustomFormat property.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.DateTimeInput.CustomFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom date/time format string.
member.remarks:
To display string literals that contain date and time separators or format strings listed below, you must use escape characters in the substring. For example, to display the date as "June 15 at 12:00 PM", set the CustomFormat property to "MMMM dd 'at' t:mm tt". If the "at" substring is not enclosed by escape characters, the result is "June 15 aP 12:00PM" because the "t" character is read as the one-letter A.M./P.M. format string (see the format string table below).
To display single quote in custom format use two single quotes characters like so '' after each other and they will be displayed as single quote.
The following list shows all the valid format strings and their descriptions:
Format String Description
d The one- or two-digit day.
dd The two-digit day. Single-digit day values are preceded by a 0.
ddd The three-character day-of-week abbreviation.
dddd The full day-of-week name.
jjj The three-digit day-of-year day. Single and two-digit values are preceded by 0.
j The three-digit day-of-year day.
h The one- or two-digit hour in 12-hour format.
hh The two-digit hour in 12-hour format. Single digit values are preceded by a 0.
H The one- or two-digit hour in 24-hour format.
HH The two-digit hour in 24-hour format. Single digit values are preceded by a 0.
m The one- or two-digit minute.
mm The two-digit minute. Single digit values are preceded by a 0.
M The one- or two-digit month number.
MM The two-digit month number. Single digit values are preceded by a 0.
MMM The three-character month abbreviation.
MMMM The full month name.
s The one- or two-digit seconds.
ss The two-digit seconds. Single digit values are preceded by a 0.
t The one-letter A.M./P.M. abbreviation (A.M. is displayed as "A").
tt The two-letter A.M./P.M. abbreviation (A.M. is displayed as "AM").
y The one-digit year (2001 is displayed as "1").
yy The last two digits of the year (2001 is displayed as "01").
yyyy The full year (2001 is displayed as "2001").
{ Starts the nested date-time group inside of the control. Note that nested groups must always be closed. Nested date-time groups can be used to represent range of input date/time values in the control To access nested values use Values property. For example to have control represent the input from two time values you could set CustomFormat to 'from' {HH:mm} 'to' {HH:mm} which will create two nested date/time groups that represent the time value. Entered time values can be accessed through Values property which return an array of all input values.
} Ends the nested date-time input group.

member.name: E:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.DateSelected
member.summary:
Occurs when the user makes an explicit date selection using the mouse.
This event is similar to the DateChanged event, but it occurs at the end of a date selection made using the mouse. The DateChanged event occurs during any date selection, whether by mouse, keyboard, or code. You should handle this event when you enable multiple date selection through MultiSelect property and want to be notified after the date selection has been made. DateChanged event would fire each time selection changes during the selection of multiple dates.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of days that can be selected in a month calendar control.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.SelectionStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the start date of the selected range of dates.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.SelectionEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the end date of the selected range of dates.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.SelectionRange
member.summary:
Gets or sets the selected range of dates for a month calendar control.
Setting this property is functionally equivalent to using the SetSelectionRange method. You can set the start and end dates separately by setting either the SelectionStart or SelectionEnd properties. You cannot change the start and end dates by setting the SelectionRange.Start or SelectionRange.End property values of the SelectionRange property. You should use SelectionStart, SelectionEnd, or SetSelectionRange. If the Start property value of the SelectionRange is greater than its End property value, the dates are swapped; the End property value becomes the starting date, and Start property value becomes the end date.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.ShouldSerializeSelectionRange
member.summary: Returns whether property should be serialized by Windows Forms desginer.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.DateTimeAdv.MonthCalendarItem.SetSelectionRange(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Sets the selected dates in a month calendar control to the specified date range.
member.param: The beginning date of the selection range.
The end date of the selection range.
member.exception:
startDate is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.
-or-
startDate is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.
-or-
endDate is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.
-or- endDate is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.
member.remarks: If the startDate value is greater than endDate property value, the dates are swapped; the endDate value becomes the starting date, and startDate value becomes the end date.

member.summary: Applies current date selection to the control. You are usually not required to make calls to this method directly since it is automatically done by the control when selection changes. This method returns immediately if MultiSelect property is set to false or SelectionStart or SelectionEnd properties have DateTime.MinValue.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.IpAddressInput.IsInputReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether input part of the control is read-only. When set to true the input part of the control becomes read-only and does not allow the typing. However, drop-down part if visible still allows user to possibly change the value of the control through the method you can provide on drop-down. Use this property to allow change of the value through drop-down button only.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.IpAddressInput.ShowCheckBox
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a check box is displayed to the left of the input value. Set to true if a check box is displayed to the left of the input value; otherwise, false. The default is false.
When the ShowCheckBox property is set to true, a check box is displayed to the left of the input in the control. When the check box is selected, the value can be updated. When the check box is cleared, the value is unable to be changed. You can handle the LockUpdateChanged event to be notified when this check box is checked and unchecked. Use LockUpdateChecked property to get or sets whether check box is checked.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.IpAddressInput.LockUpdateChecked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether check box shown using ShowCheckBox property which locks/unlocks the control update is checked.

member.summary: Raises the LockUpdateChanged event.

member.summary: List of characters that when pressed would select next input field. For example if you are allowing time input you could set this property to : so when user presses the : character, the input is forwarded to the next input field.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NumericInputBase class.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.NumericInputBase.IsInputReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether input part of the control is read-only. When set to true the input part of the control becomes read-only and does not allow the typing. However, drop-down and up/down buttons part if visible still allows user to possibly change the value of the control through the method you can provide on drop-down or through up/down buttons. Use this property to allow change of the value through drop-down or up/down buttons only.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.NumericInputBase.ShowCheckBox
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a check box is displayed to the left of the input value. Set to true if a check box is displayed to the left of the input value; otherwise, false. The default is false.
When the ShowCheckBox property is set to true, a check box is displayed to the left of the input in the control. When the check box is selected, the value can be updated. When the check box is cleared, the value is unable to be changed. You can handle the LockUpdateChanged event to be notified when this check box is checked and unchecked. Use LockUpdateChecked property to get or sets whether check box is checked.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.NumericInputBase.LockUpdateChecked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether check box shown using ShowCheckBox property which locks/unlocks the control update is checked.

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.NumericInputBase.OnLockUpdateChanged(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the LockUpdateChanged event.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.NumericInputBase._ShowUpDown
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a spin button control (up-down control) is used to adjust the current value. The default is false.
When the ShowUpDown property is set to true, a spin button control is shown to adjust value of currently focused input item. The value can be adjusted by using the up and down buttons to change the value.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.NumericInputBase.DisplayFormat
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Numeric String Format that is used to format the numeric value entered for display purpose. Read more about available formats in MSDN under "Standard Numeric Format Strings" and "Custom Numeric Format Strings" topics.
The format specified here indicates the format for display purpose only, not for the input purpose. For example to display the number in system Currency format set the DisplayFormat to 'C'.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Controls.Win.Editors.VisualNumericInput.AllowEmptyState
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control allows empty input state i.e. does not have an number entered. Default value is true. When control is empty IsEmpty property returns true and control does not display number. Set to false to always force control to have number displayed.
